0.title: A very big decision in the interest of Punjabis will be announced shortly: CM Mann
0.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday tweeted, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab." "No one in the history of Punjab would have taken such a decision till date. I'll announce shortly," he added. Mann was sworn in as the CM of the state on Wednesday.

1.title: Lead coffin, likely from 14th cnetury, found under Paris' Notre Dame
1.article_body: Archaeologists have found an ancient lead sarcophagus with well-preserved contents, probably from the 14th century, under Paris' Notre Dame cathedral. Christophe Besnier from France's National Archaeological Institute said a small camera placed inside the sarcophagus showed "cloth remains, organic matter such as hair and plant remains". A pit was also found immediately below the cathedral floor.

2.title: Let them throw me out: Teejay on not being allowed to board Dubai flight over visa issue
2.article_body: Actress Teejay Sidhu was stranded at Delhi airport after not being allowed to board Dubai flight with her three daughters over visa issue. Teejay, who missed the initial flight, claimed Emirates staff members were rude to her and also threatened to call security. She said they weren't allowing her to stay at airport premises, adding, "Let them throw me out."

3.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy personally wrote to Zuckerberg to block Facebook in Russia: Report
3.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reportedly wrote letters to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg asking them to ban Facebook and Instagram from within Russia's borders. However, Meta's President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg replied to the letters, the report said. Facebook restricted certain Russian state media outlets in Ukraine after Zelenskyy's request, it added.

4.title: Delhi Police opposes Shahrukh Pathan's bail plea in 2020 firing case
4.article_body: Delhi Police has opposed the bail plea of Shahrukh Pathan who is accused of allegedly pointing a gun at a constable during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots and firing three-four rounds of shots. He has a family history of criminal cases, police added. "The accused has been keeping illegal arms and ammunition...has no remorse for his illegal act," police added.

5.title: Mamata Banerjee conspiring to make WB another Pakistan: BJP's Arjun Singh
5.article_body: BJP MP Arjun Singh said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is "conspiring to make West Bengal another Pakistan". Singh stated that Banerjee is against the Bihari migrants in the state. "Mamata Banerjee has always been against Biharis. Industries in the state are being shut down so that they don't work...Bihar people have given us labour force," Singh said.

6.title: UP man puts tractor silencer on bike, writes 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' on number plate
6.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested three men for riding a bike with the number plate reading 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' and have seized their bike. The arrested men were identified as Ankit Paal, Anuj Paal and Shivam. Photos showed that the bike was modified and the accused had replaced the silencer of the bike with a tractor's silencer.

7.title: Big B invited us to dinner after Satte Pe Satta got completed: Shakti
7.article_body: Actor Shakti Kapoor said he can watch Satte Pe Satta 200 times. "I watch it whenever I'm sad," he added. The actor recalled that Amitabh Bachchan invited the entire cast for dinner after the film's shoot got completed. "That evening was...fun that we started at 8:30 pm and wrapped it up by 7 am...It was an unforgettable experience," he added.

8.title: Pics show Ukraine theatre before and after Russia dropped powerful bomb
8.article_body: Ukraine's Minister of Foreign Affairs Dmytro Kuleba has posted pics showing the Mariupol theatre before and after Russia dropped a powerful bomb. "Another horrendous war crime in Mariupol...The building is now fully ruined," he wrote. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov had said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building.

9.title: Good luck finding a wife: Sunny Leone to man who got tattoo of her name
9.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a video with a man who has a tattoo of her name on his arm. "Hope you love me forever!! Because now you have no choice. Good luck finding a wife," she captioned the video. She can be seen wearing yellow and pink saree in video and thanking man with the tattoo.

10.title: Felt horrible, angry from inside during film research: 'The Kashmir...' writer
10.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' writer Saurabh M Pandey said that he felt horrible during the research for the film. "I had to switch to other work...I had to give it some time, I used to feel why did these things happen, used to be very angry from inside...used to be upset and angry at the same time," he added.

11.title: 73,219 posts vacant in paramilitary forces: Nityanand Rai
11.article_body: As many as 73,219 posts are vacant in paramilitary forces due to retirements, resignations, deaths and cadre reviews, MoS for Home Affairs, Nityanand Rai, told the Parliament on Wednesday. "Filling up of vacancies is an ongoing continuous process which is done as per the administrative and operational requirement of the forces," Rai added.

12.title: 3 earthquakes jolt Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh in a day
12.article_body: Three earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. While two earthquakes with magnitude 5.2 and 4.3 hit Ladakh at 7:05 pm and 7:34 pm respectively, another earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Ritcher scale hit Srinagar at 9:40 pm.

13.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in the world right now: Vaughan
13.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has termed Pakistan captain Babar Azam as the best batter across formats at the moment. "Brilliant across formats," tweeted Vaughan after Babar scored 196 during the second innings in their second Test against Australia. Babar is currently top-ranked batter in ICC rankings in ODIs and T20Is and among the top 10 in Tests.

14.title: Russians shouldn't pay for their authoritarian leader: Patreon CEO
14.article_body: Patreon CEO Jack Conte in an interview said the firm continues to operate in Russia, adding he doesn't believe individual creators "should have to pay for the misdeeds of their authoritarian leader". "They may disagree with the war, and I don't want to punish them," he added. Conte also said the decision on operations was not controversial internally at Patreon.

15.title: 1.75 crore houses completed under PM Awas Yojana-Gramin: Centre
15.article_body: As many as 1.75 crore houses have been completed under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Gramin (PMAY-G), MoS for Rural Development Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti said. Around 2.28 crore houses were sanctioned to the beneficiaries till March 9, 2022, she added. Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of PMAY-G till March 2024 for completion of remaining houses, Jyoti stated.

16.title: Saba Khan shares mother Sharmila Tagore's pics with Pandit Jawaharal Nehru
16.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan's sister Saba Ali Khan took to Instagram to share a video of her mother Sharmila Tagore's pictures, including one with India's first Prime Minister, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. "A star is born...a child protégé...a star. Proud of you! Wish you life's best moments, always...Keep shining," Saba captioned the post.

17.title: Never beaten Deepika in badminton despite trying for 10 years: Ranveer
17.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he has "never" beaten wife and actress Deepika Padukone in badminton, despite trying for 10 years. "Deepika kicks my butt in badminton. I am running around sweating," added Ranveer. Ranveer and Deepika were last seen together in the film '83'. While Ranveer played cricketer Kapil Dev in the film, Deepika played his wife Romi.

18.title: Want to hold on to that forever: Kim on finding happiness with Pete Davidson
18.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with Pete Davidson, Kim Kardashian said that she decided to seek her happiness and she found it. "I was like...'I'm in my 40s like f**k it...go for it. Find your happiness'," she added. Kim further said she feels "so good" after finding happiness with Pete. "I want to hold on to that forever," she added.

19.title: The tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone: Kirron on 'The Kashmir...'
19.article_body: Talking about 'The Kashmir Files' which stars her husband-actor Anupam Kher, actor-politician Kirron Kher tweeted, "The stark and tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone." "It is the chronicling of a humanitarian crisis that was ignored for...years," added Kirron. "[Director] Vivek Agnihotri used to hug me..., we cried. It was...one of the most difficult roles," Anupam had earlier said.

20.title: For weeks I have been heckled, threatened, questioned: Man Utd’s Rashford
20.article_body: Reacting to a video of him arguing with a fan who "abused" him after Manchester United's exit from Champions League, forward Marcus Rashford said, "For weeks I've been heckled, threatened, questioned..., my emotion got the better of me." "I [have] been heckled from the minute I stepped foot outside the ground, abuse not just aimed at my football," added Rashford.

21.title: 61,882 arrested in drug trafficking cases in 2021: Govt
21.article_body: A total of 61,882 persons were arrested by the central and state Drug Law Enforcement Agencies (DLEAs) in drug trafficking cases across the country in 2021, the government informed on Wednesday. Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said 99.36% of them were Indians, 0.64% were foreign nationals as per the provisional data of Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB).

22.title: People with new COVID variant had mild symptoms of fever, headaches, muscle dystrophy
22.article_body: Israel has said that two patients who have tested positive for a new variant of COVID-19 had mild symptoms of fever, headaches and muscle dystrophy. It however said that they did not require any special medical intervention. The variant may have originated in Israel, health ministry director-general Nachman Ash said.

23.title: Year's 1st cyclone 'Asani' likely to form over Bay of Bengal on March 21: IMD
23.article_body: This year's first cyclone, 'Asani', is likely to form over the central Bay of Bengal on March 21, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). It is unlikely to cross the Indian coast but heavy rain and strong winds are expected over Andaman and Nicobar Islands. "Our models indicate Asani may cross Bangladesh or adjoining north Myanmar coasts," said an IMD official.

24.title: China's richest billionaires gain $71 billion as stocks jump most since 2008
24.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 75 richest billionaires surged by $71 billion on Wednesday as stocks across Hong Kong and China jumped the most since the 2008 financial crisis. Tencent's Pony Ma, NetEase's William Ding and Pinduoduo's Colin Huang, added over $5 billion each to their net worths, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

25.title: Next two months are going to be special: Rahul as he joins LSG's bubble
25.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul entered the mandatory three-day quarantine ahead of the IPL season and said that the next two months are going to be very special. "The new season gives us a great opportunity as a new franchise to do something special," he added. LSG will play their first match against Gujarat Titans on March 28.

26.title: It told us where we stand: Nagaland captain as Jharkhand score 1,297 runs
26.article_body: Jharkhand qualified for the quarterfinals of the Ranji Trophy 2021-22 after taking a lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland, having scored 1,297 runs across both innings. Nagaland captain Rongsen Jonathan said he is "happy" to concede 1,297 runs in a match, as it tells them where they stand. Jharkhand's 1,008-run lead marks the highest-ever lead in a first-class match.

27.title: Thought Lara will struggle with on-drives, he hit 3 fours in 1 over: Muralitharan
27.article_body: Muttiah Muralitharan said he tried to dismiss Brian Lara by opening the mid-on area to encourage him to play on-drives, which were difficult to play with the ball spinning during Lara's 221 in Colombo back in 2001. "[Lara] hit three fours in the mid-on region in one over," added Muralitharan. "I am...amazed by the shots [he] played," stated Muralitharan.

28.title: 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners identified, over 30,000 deported: Assam govt
28.article_body: More than 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners have been identified till January 31 on the basis of the Assam Accord, out of which 30,014 have been deported to their country of origin, said the state government on Wednesday. Minister Atul Bora added that 98.35% of fencing work along the India-Bangladesh border in the state has been completed.

29.title: 2 men on high-end racing bike snatch woman's gold chain in Pune; case filed
29.article_body: Two men, riding a high-end racing bike, allegedly snatched a gold chain from a woman riding pillion with her husband on his motorcycle in Pune. The incident reportedly happened on Tuesday night when the couple was returning home after purchasing groceries. The couple has lodged an FIR at Nigdi Police Station. Attempts are on to arrest the robbers, police said.

30.title: 5 arrested for stealing gun of Raghav Chadha's security officer in Punjab
30.article_body: The Nawanshahr police have arrested five persons accused of stealing a revolver from AAP leader Raghav Chadha's security officer during the party's victory roadshow in Amritsar. The police said that the accused were caught after they hit a car with their Scorpio while travelling from Nawanshahr to Khatkar Kalan. The police recovered the stolen revolver during checking.

31.title: Reliance's drastic action came as a surprise: Future Retail on stores' takeover
31.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) has said it's committed to taking all actions "necessary to seek value adjustments and reversal of takeover of stores" by Reliance Industries (RIL). RIL's "drastic and unilateral action" to takeover stores came as a "surprise" to FRL, it added. It also complicated the positive scenario which was building up after the CCI order in December, FRL claimed.

32.title: Delhi court grants bail to man who tried to break into NSA Doval's house
32.article_body: A Delhi court granted bail to a man who was arrested in February for trying to break into National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval's residence on Tughlaq Road. "Considering...the background of accused and the fact that accused is in custody since February 16 and no more is required for investigation, the accused/applicant is admitted to bail," the court added.

33.title: How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?: Cong's Randeep Surjewala
33.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala criticised the Centre and said, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?" He added, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been given jobs?" Addressing a press event, Surjewala said that atrocities had been occurring even during the VP Singh-led government. "Only one party protested. Opposition leader Rajiv Gandhi gheraoed the Parliament," Surjewala added.

34.title: Man hits friend with stone, stabs him to death after argument in Nagpur
34.article_body: A man killed his 24-year-old friend after an argument in Nagpur's Kalmana area. Reports said that the two were consuming alcohol and that the accused slit the victim's throat following an argument, after which, the victim started running. But the accused caught him and hit him in the head with a stone. He then stabbed the victim to death.

35.title: Rizwan saved the Test for us eventually: Babar on Karachi Test
35.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said it was Mohammad Rizwan who saved Karachi Test for them against Australia after he remained unbeaten at 104. "We took the onus and the main focus was to build partnerships right throughout the day," said Babar, who himself scored 196 runs during their chase of 506 runs. Abdullah Shafique scored 96 in the innings.

36.title: BSF seizes 2 Pakistani fishing boats in Gujarat's Bhuj
36.article_body: Two Pakistani boats were seized by the Border Security Force (BSF) at Sir Creek area in Gujarat's Bhuj on Wednesday. "Movement of two Pakistani fishing boats and four-five Pakistani fishermen was observed by...BSF. The Pakistani fishermen on observing the BSF troops coming towards them fled into the Pakistani territory...BSF...chased them and seized two...boats," BSF said in a statement.

37.title: UK warns Russia 'likely resorting to less precise weapons'
37.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry on Thursday said Russia's failure to control Ukrainian airspace means it has probably "expended far more stand-off air launched weapons than originally planned". "As a result, it is likely Russia is resorting to the use of older, less precise weapons, which are less militarily effective and more likely to result in civilian casualties," the ministry added.

38.title: Shreyas can look 25 & 42 at same time: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad
38.article_body: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad Desai said actor Shreyas Talpade can look 25 and 42 at same time. "We always wanted somebody who embodies the body language, the physicality of a cricketer...Shreyas is a powerhouse performer...I was glad when we got to know that he had agreed to come on board and he has delivered an exemplary performance," he added.

39.title: Mumbai lost over 2,000 hectares of urban tree cover in 5 years: Study
39.article_body: Mumbai lost about 2,028 hectares of urban tree cover in the past five years, a study by World Resources Institute (WRI) India revealed. The data published in the Mumbai Climate Action Plan (MCAP) said Central and Western Mumbai recorded the maximum decrease in tree cover. The loss contributed to emission of 19,640.9 tonnes of CO2 per year, the report added.

40.title: Grandmother asks Guj man who he's talking to on call, he hits her with ladle
40.article_body: A 21-year-old man hit his 69-year-old grandmother with a ladle after she asked who he was speaking to over the phone. The grandson, Ruchit, reportedly started abusing her. The woman, Shanta Supehia, asked him not to use foul language against her, following which, he hit her with the ladle. Shanta then started bleeding and her husband came to her rescue.

41.title: Dharmendra shares pic with son Sunny, says 'Rare chance to be with him'
41.article_body: Taking to Twitter, veteran actor Dharmendra shared a picture with his son Sunny Deol, from a vacation in the mountains. The photo showed them posing for the camera with a large, snow-capped mountain behind them. Sharing the picture, Dharmendra wrote, "Extremely happy to be with Sunny. A rare chance to [be] with each other."

42.title: Officials to evaluate pollution impact of Supertech towers demolition
42.article_body: Ahead of the Supertech twin towers demolition in Noida Sector 93A, the state pollution control board will evaluate the amount of pollution which will be caused in the process. "With regard to...pollution aspect, laws will have to be complied (with)," said UPPCB officer Praveen Kumar. The process is expected to briefly cause a spike in the quantity of dust particles.

43.title: Thane man dies by suicide with 11-yr-old daughter, blames police officer
43.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide along with his 11-year-old daughter in Shahapur town of Thane. Victim Vikas Kedare allegedly blamed a police officer in a two-page suicide note, police said. According to police, Kedare and his mother were arrested after his wife died by suicide last year. He was released after spending four months in jail, police added.

44.title: South Korea reports record 6 lakh COVID-19 cases and record 429 deaths in 24 hours
44.article_body: South Korea reported a record 6,21,328 new daily COVID-19 cases, and a record 429 daily deaths, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Thursday, amid a wave of Omicron infections. The country reported 55% increase in daily COVID-19 cases. South Korea had reported 4,00,741 cases on Wednesday.

45.title: Hardik Pandya passes Yo-Yo test at NCA, Prithvi Shaw fails it: Reports
45.article_body: Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya passed Yo-Yo test at a camp at NCA in Bengaluru, while Delhi Capitals' Prithvi Shaw failed it, reports said. The standard score to clear the test is 16.5. As per reports, Shaw scored less than 15, while Hardik scored more than 17 in the test. Hardik also bowled regularly at the camp, reports added.

46.title: World's biggest telescope captures star with ancient galaxies in background, pic released
46.article_body: James Webb Space Telescope, the world's biggest and most powerful space telescope, completed its final round of fine phasing to correct its alignment errors. During the process, the telescope focussed on a single star, however, several ancient galaxies and stars also showed up in the background due to the telescope's sensitive optics. NASA released a picture of the star.

47.title: Delhi's air quality improves to 'moderate' category; AQI at 190
47.article_body: Delhi's air pollution level improved on Thursday morning with the Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 190 as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). According to SAFAR, the AQI improved due to an increase in the maximum temperature. Further, Gurugram and Noida recorded an AQI of 149 and 193 respectively on Thursday morning.

48.title: Indian-American contestant Shree Saini becomes 1st runner-up at Miss World 2021
48.article_body: Punjab-born Shree Saini was crowned the first runner-up at the 70th Miss World beauty pageant held in Puerto Rico. She is the first Indian-American to win Miss World America. Having completed her Bachelor's Degree in Journalism, Shree is currently working as a Business Manager at her father's company and as a Keynote Speaker.

49.title: Govt admits IIM-Rohtak Director didn't meet qualification criterion but was still appointed
49.article_body: After repeated denials, the Union Government has admitted to the court that IIM-Rohtak Director Dheeraj Sharma, whom it had appointed, did not meet the minimum educational qualification criterion. He was appointed despite securing a second division at the undergraduate level. Sharma completed his five-year term on February 9 this year and has got a second term.

50.title: Netflix tests charging a fee for sharing accounts outside households
50.article_body: Netflix is testing charging a fee to subscribers who share accounts with people outside their households. The sharing of accounts is "impacting our ability to invest in great new TV and films", Netflix said. The feature will be tested in Chile, Costa Rica and Peru, allowing users to add two people who don't live with them, for an extra charge.

51.title: Sensex jumps 1,000 points after US Fed's 1st rate hike in 3 years
51.article_body: Indian benchmark indices gained over 1.5% on Thursday, tracking gains in the global markets, following the US Federal Reserve's first rate hike in over three years. The Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to trade above 57,800, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 280 points to trade at 17,250 levels. HDFC and Kotak Mahindra Bank were among top gainers.

52.title: 4 killed, over 90 injured after 7.4 magnitude earthquake hits Japan
52.article_body: At least four people have been killed and over 90 have been injured after a 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck northern Japan on Wednesday night and prompted a tsunami warning. Tens of thousands of households have been left without power after the earthquake. The quake struck the same region where a powerful earthquake triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster 11 years ago.

53.title: Powerful bomb dropped by Russia on theatre sheltering 1,000-1,200 people in Ukraine
53.article_body: Russian forces dropped a powerful bomb on a theatre in Ukraine's Mariupol on Wednesday, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building. Russia's Defence Ministry said its forces had not struck the building and instead accused the Azov Battalion, a far-right Ukrainian militia, of blowing it up.

54.title: Russians, Ukrainians facing attacks in Germany, say police
54.article_body: The German police have said that they have registered at least 500 reports of politically motivated attacks against the Russian and Ukrainian communities in the country since the conflict between the two countries broke out. Some bottles were reportedly thrown at the windows of a Russian church in Berlin. In another incident, a Ukrainian refugee family's car was burned.

55.title: You won't see players playing for ₹16 cr in PSL: Aakash on Raja's remark on IPL
55.article_body: Reacting to PCB chief Ramiz Raja's remark that players will choose PSL over IPL if they go for auction, commentator Aakash Chopra said, "You won't see a player playing for ₹16 crore in the PSL...market dynamics [won't] allow that." Aakash added, "Chris Morris' one ball, when he played last time, was more expensive than the players' salary in other leagues."

56.title: Honour to watch him bat: Eng batting coach on Root's 2nd straight Test ton
56.article_body: England batting coach Marcus Trescothick has said it's an honour to see England Test captain Joe Root bat during the matches. Root slammed his second hundred in as many innings after scoring 119* off 246 on Day 1 in the ongoing second Test against West Indies. "To get a hundred last week and repeat it again, it's superb," Trescothick added.

57.title: US' Amagi, founded by 3 Indians, turns unicorn after raising $95 mn
57.article_body: US-based SaaS mediatech startup Amagi has become a unicorn after raising $95 million led by Accel. Others who participated in the funding include Norwest Venture Partners and Avataar Ventures. Founded by three Indians, Baskar Subramanian, KA Srinivasan and Srividhya Srinivasan, Amagi has raised over $245 million to date. It had raised $100 million around six months ago.

58.title: Want to live your best life? Make it happen: Godrej Park Retreat
58.article_body: Spread across 13 acres, Godrej Park Retreat offers 1, 2 and 3 BHK apartments in Sarjapur Road, Bangalore. Godrej Properties revealed that the township is situated close to the best hospitals, educational institutions, hotels, recreation centres and many large tech parks. Godrej Park Retreat has a clubhouse, 50+ amenities and 4.06 acres of greens.

59.title: Karan, Ananya & Manish attend Shweta Bachchan's b'day party, pics surface
59.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's daughter, Shweta Bachchan, celebrated her 48th birthday on Wednesday. Several Bollywood celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, Karan Johar, Ananya Panday, Manish Malhotra, Sidharth Malhotra and Shanaya Kapoor attended the party. As pictures surfaced online, Shweta seemingly kept white as the colour theme for her guests' outfits.

60.title: Ill-fated van was bought days ago: Mother of Indian student killed in Canada
60.article_body: Mother of 24-year-old Harpreet Singh, who was one of the five Indian students killed in a road mishap in Canada, said that the "ill-fated van had been purchased merely a few days ago". "For the last two years, he had been working as a driver on a work permit. He had been driving students from Brampton to Montreal," she added.

61.title: Only 60 aged 12-15 yrs get vaccinated in Pune as CoWIN glitch halts process
61.article_body: Only 60 children aged between 12 to 15 years could get vaccinated on first day of vaccination process for them in Pune. The Pune Municipal Corporation had set up 29 centres for vaccination of the age group. However, no registrations could be done due to glitch in the CoWin website. The website reportedly only started working post-lunch hours.

62.title: Govt to implement ₹7,500-cr scheme to tackle road mishaps: Nitin Gadkari
62.article_body: The Centre said it is planning to partner with the World Bank to implement a ₹7,500-crore scheme to reduce accident-prone areas and black spots on national and state highways, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said. India doesn't have a good record on road accident front and registers the world’s highest deaths due to it at 1.5 lakh every year, Gadkari added.

63.title: Over 2 lakh kids in 12-14 age group given COVID vaccine doses on Day 1
63.article_body: As many as 2,60,136 kids aged 12-14 were given COVID-19 vaccine doses on the first day as vaccination for 12-14 age group started on Wednesday, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. More than 2.15 crore precaution doses for identified categories of beneficiaries (HCWs, FLWs and over 60 years) for COVID-19 vaccination have been administered so far, the Ministry added.

64.title: Who voted for and who voted against Russia at ICJ over Ukraine invasion?
64.article_body: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) asked Russia to immediately halt its invasion of Ukraine in a 13-2 decision. Out of the 15 judges at the ICJ, judges from USA, Slovakia, France, Morocco, Somalia, Uganda, India, Jamaica, Lebanon, Japan, Germany, Australia and Judge ad hoc  Yves Daudet voted against Russia. Judges from Russia and China voted for Russia.

65.title: BJP MLA demands separate state of North Bengal in WB Assembly
65.article_body: BJP MLA from Darjeeling's Kurseong, Bishnu Prasad Sharma, on Wednesday demanded a separate state of North Bengal in the West Bengal Assembly. "The hills have been deprived for a very long time. Various communities...such as Gorkhas, Rajbanshis, Adivasis have been deprived," Sharma added. "We want North Bengal to be a separate state so that our problems are addressed," he stated.

66.title: Only 101 children turn up for vaccination in Chandigarh Tricity on Day 1
66.article_body: The COVID-19 vaccination drive for children aged 12-14 years which kicked off on Wednesday, opened to a poor response in Chandigarh Tricity with only 101 kids showing up to get the jab. The first dose of the Corbevax vaccine was administered to four, 37 and 60 children in Mohali, Chandigarh and Panchkula respectively on the first day.

67.title: Who is Miss World 2021 winner Karolina Bielawska?
67.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska, who has been crowned Miss World 2021, is currently studying for a Master's Degree in Management and would like to continue her studies with a PhD. She also works as a model and hopes to become a motivational speaker. "She enjoys swimming and scuba diving and playing tennis and badminton," read a post by Miss World organisation.

68.title: Deepfake video shows Zelenskyy telling Ukrainians to surrender; he calls it 'childish'
68.article_body: A video purportedly showing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calling on his country's forces to lay down arms is a "deepfake", Meta said, removing the video from Facebook. Zelenskyy also rebutted the video, calling it a "childish provocation". "I only advise that the troops of the Russian Federation lay down their arms and return home," he said.

69.title: Who is Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at ICJ?
69.article_body: Justice Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at the International Court of Justice, was born in Jodhpur. Bhandari practised at the Rajasthan High Court from 1968 to 1970 and then went to US on an international scholarship to pursue a Master of Laws degree. He also served as a senior judge of the Supreme Court of India.

70.title: Military operation in Ukraine developing successfully: Putin
70.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that the military operation in Ukraine was developing successfully. "The operation is developing successfully and in strict accordance with plans," he said. Asserting that Russia had no other option than to send troops, he added, "We will not allow Ukraine to serve as a springboard for aggressive actions against Russia."

71.title: I'm practising hard, not thinking too much about Team India call-up: Dhawan
71.article_body: Team India batter Shikhar Dhawan, who'll feature for PBKS in the upcoming IPL season, has said he's practising hard and not thinking too much about the Team India call-up. "If it doesn't happen then [also] I'm happy and without tension," he stated. Dhawan's appearance has been limited to ODIs since he was dropped from India's 2021 T20I World Cup squad.

72.title: Got fired for reviewing Tesla's FSD tech on YouTube: Ex-US employee
72.article_body: A former US Tesla employee John Bernal has claimed he was fired after he posted reviews on Tesla's driverless tech on his YouTube channel. He said his YouTube channel was cited as the reason for his dismissal. Bernal said Tesla also cut off his access to the FSD Beta system in the vehicle he personally owns.

73.title: Labourer kills co-worker, dumps body on river bank in Pune; arrested
73.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 36-year-old labourer for killing a co-worker and dumping his body on the banks of Mula river. "One of them had sold a phone to the other and payment was pending. A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

74.title: India reports 2,539 new COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths; active cases at 30,799
74.article_body: India has reported 2,539 new COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 60 deaths, 22 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 38 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,132, and the active cases declined to 30,799.

75.title: What was the answer that won Poland's Karolina Bielawska the Miss World 2021 crown?
75.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was asked, "What's the most important discovery yet to be discovered?" "We all have unique experiences and all of us can learn something about ourselves...It costs us so little to enrich others' lives," she said. "If you'd like to discover something new, try to learn to be rich in more empathy, in compassion, in gratitude," Karolina added.

76.title: I wouldn't change too much, but catches could've made the difference: Cummins
76.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has said he wouldn't change too much in terms of their tactics in the second Test against Pakistan, which ended in a draw after Pakistan managed to save three wickets. He, however, also admitted that missed catches in the second innings could've made the difference. Australia missed at least four catches in Pakistan's second innings.

77.title: Girls who questioned hijab verdict are members of terror body: BJP leader
77.article_body: BJP leader Yashpal Suvarna, who is also Vice-President of Udupi Government PU College Development Committee, on Wednesday said that the girls who questioned Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban are "anti-national" and "members of a terrorist organisation". "The girls have proved once again that they are not students but members of a terrorist organisation," he said.

78.title: PM & govt must rise above petty politics, propaganda films: Owaisi
78.article_body: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Narendra Modi and the Centre must rise above their "petty politics" and "propaganda films", criticising Union Minister Rajnath Singh's statement concerning the accidental missile-firing which landed in Pakistan. Citing a report claiming, India's accidental missile-firing prompted Pakistan to prepare a retaliatory strike, Owaisi said Singh's statement told nothing.

79.title: 19-yr-old girl steals ₹8 lakh from home, elopes with man in Zirakpur
79.article_body: A 19-year-old girl and her 22-year-old boyfriend were booked by police after the girl stole ₹8 lakh from her home and eloped with the man. The girl's family alleged the man instigated their daughter into stealing the money after luring her with marriage. She went missing on February 28. Her parents found she eloped with her boyfriend through her friends.

80.title: All truth-seekers should watch 'The Kashmir Files': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
80.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that all the truth-seekers should watch the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. His remarks came after meeting the movie's director Vivek Agnihotri and actress Pallavi Joshi in New Delhi. "A brilliantly written script, a complete artistic work and a thorough research," Bhagwat said. The movie was released in theatres on March 11.

81.title: Don’t Memorise acquired by Infinity Learn
81.article_body: Infinity Learn by Sri Chaitanya announced acquisition of Don't Memorise, a multilingual YouTube content platform, founded by Ganesh Pai. Ujjwal Singh, CEO of Infinity Learn, said he welcomes 2.5 million users to its family with open arms. Ganesh calls this acquisition a golden opportunity to develop more K-10 learning solutions and scale their YouTube channel even more.

82.title: Don't want anyone to reduce my achievements: Vidya on not working with husband
82.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, who's married to producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, said they decided not to work together after their 2013 film 'Ghanchakkar'. "I don't want anyone to reduce my achievements to saying this happened for you because of your husband," she added. "One has worked...hard to get here and...I don't want that to happen for either of us," Vidya said.

83.title: Bappi Lahiri's daughter breaks down as his grandson sings late singer's song
83.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's daughter Rema Lahiri broke down at an event when her son Swastik Bansal sang one of the late singer's songs at an event recently. In his tribute, Swastik sang 'Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna' which was composed by Bappi Lahiri and sung by Kishore Kumar. Swastik also broke down towards the end of his performance.

84.title: Doing our best to ensure production at Shanghai plant: Tesla
84.article_body: Tesla has said it is doing its best to keep production going at its Shanghai factory amid China's COVID-19 prevention measures. This comes after a Reuters report said the firm had suspended production at the plant for two days. "We are actively cooperating with the government's requirements for nucleic acid testing and other epidemic prevention requirements," Tesla said.

85.title: Pune's double-decker flyover opened for public, to reduce traffic congestion
85.article_body: Pune's double-decker Nal Stop flyover has been opened for public use. It will help in reduction of traffic congestion on Karve Road in the city. "At Nal Stop, 35,000 to 40,000 vehicles pass every hour during peak hours, so it's important to have a flyover on this stretch," Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol had earlier said.

86.title: Liquor shops closed for 2 days in Hyd's Rachakonda ahead of Holi
86.article_body: Liquor shops will remain closed for two days from 6 pm on Thursday to 6 am on Saturday within Rachakonda Commissionerate limits ahead of Holi, police said. Wine shops, toddy shops and bars attached to restaurants, excluding those attached to star hotels and clubs, would be closed, police added. Groups moving aimlessly on their vehicles are prohibited, police stated.

87.title: 'The Kashmir Files' didn't show complete truth, only violence: C'garh CM
87.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files' with several MLAs on Wednesday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that the film did not show the complete truth and the makers only tried to highlight violence. "The film did not have any message. No attempt to offer any solution was made. I don't believe such a film has any relevance," said Baghel.

88.title: Bengaluru police arrest interstate car thief; recover SUVs worth ₹4 crore
88.article_body: Bengaluru police arrested a car thief who allegedly orchestrated at least 21 thefts in Bengaluru, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and Telangana. Police have recovered SUVs worth ₹4 crore from the accused, who has reportedly been involved in car thefts since 2003. "Accused used hacking devices and key-making machines to unlock high-end cars," Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop Shetty said.

89.title: Poland's Karolina Bielawska crowned Miss World 2021, India's Manasa reaches semi-final
89.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was crowned Miss World 2021 by Jamaica's Toni-Ann Singh, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. US' Shree Saini was named first runner-up while Olivia Yace from Cote d'Ivoire was named second runner-up. Manasa Varanasi, who represented India, was among the semi-finalists. The event was earlier scheduled to take place in December 2021, but was postponed due to COVID-19.

90.title: Joe Biden calls Putin 'war criminal', Russia says it's 'unacceptable'
90.article_body: US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" for the first time, after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the US Congress. He also offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine that includes armed drones. Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the comments made by Biden were "unforgivable rhetoric" and "unacceptable", as per state-run TASS.

91.title: US woman abused online after being mistaken for Russian Foreign Minister's daughter
91.article_body: A US realtor has been abused online by people mistaking her for daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov amid the war in Ukraine. Ekaterina Lavrova said, "People wish you to burn in hell, you know, 'you should be deported,' 'let's take over her apartment and host somebody from Ukraine.'" Lavrov's daughter shares the same name as the US realtor.

92.title: Sharapova, Schumacher booked for fraud for promoting Gurugram real estate project
92.article_body: Gurugram Police have booked former Russian tennis star Maria Sharapova and former Formula 1 racer Michael Schumacher for fraud and criminal conspiracy. Delhi's Shafali Agarwal complained she booked an apartment in a project named after Sharapova and was cheated of nearly ₹80 lakh. Agarwal complained Sharapova made false promises, had dinner parties with buyers but the project never took off.

93.title: Actress Park Ha-sun contributes to emergency relief in Ukraine
93.article_body: South Korean actress Park Ha-sun contributed to an emergency relief campaign to help Ukraine, her agency reportedly said. It added that the donation will be used to "purchase food and daily necessities for Ukrainian children and residents suffering from the war". She reportedly donated 10 million won (over ₹6 lakh) to NGO 'Korea Food for the Hungry International' (KFHI).

94.title: Went through depression, he was the only one who didn't leave: Shama on James
94.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who recently got married to American businessman James Milliron said that he did not leave her during her phase of depression. "I would get depressed...I did not want anybody around me...I would push them to go away...everybody would leave...he was the only one who did not leave," she said. "James said 'Sorry, I can't leave'," she added.

95.title: India's judge votes against Russia over Ukraine invasion at International Court of Justice
95.article_body: India's judge at International Court of Justice, Justice Dalveer Bhandari, voted against Russia as the UN's top court asked Russia to immediately stop its invasion of Ukraine. Thirteen judges voted against Russia, while two judges voted in favour of Russia. Earlier, India had abstained from voting on the Ukraine-Russia issue at the UN Security Council and UN General Assembly.

96.title: 3,837 kids vaccinated in Delhi on Day 1 of vaccination for 12-14 yrs old
96.article_body: As many as 3,837 kids were vaccinated against COVID-19 in Delhi on Wednesday which was the first day of vaccination for those in the 12-14 age group. Northeast Delhi vaccinated the maximum number of children at 2,310, followed by North Delhi at 362. About six to seven lakh children in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccination in Delhi.

97.title: Philippines designer makes gowns, dresses out of recycled waste
97.article_body: A designer from Philippines has been making dresses out of waste materials like recycled newspapers, plastic wrapping and rice sacks using a foot-operated sewing machine. Seamstress Leonora Buenviaje said clothes made from such items are both economical and fashionable. Her frocks and gowns, which she weaves out of plastic, are sometimes used in beauty contests and pageants, Reuters reported.

98.title: Pune Police forms special squads to maintain vigil on Holi
98.article_body: The Pune Police has formed special squads at the police station level to maintain a vigil on anti-social elements during Holi celebrations. The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation Commissionerate has also formed around 10 such squads. Officials will patrol streets in civil clothes and police teams will be stationed in sensitive areas.

99.title: Delhi Traffic Police details measures to ensure safe Holi celebrations
99.article_body: Delhi Police Joint Commissioner (Traffic) Vivek Kishore said police personnel will be deployed on all major roads and intersections on the occasion of Holi (March 18). He also urged citizens to avoid traffic violations like drunken driving, overspeeding and triple-riding. Delhi's Food Safety Department has also directed officials to ensure adulterated food products are not sold during Holi.

100.title: Air purifiers to be installed at traffic intersections in Mumbai
100.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install air purifiers at traffic intersections to reduce the impact of carbon emissions in the city. BMC has identified 70 traffic junctions where these purifiers will likely be installed in the days to come, senior civic officials said. One purifier has already been set up at the Mahapalika Marg near BMC headquarters.

101.title: London's V&A museum holds its first male fashion exhibition
101.article_body: London's V&A museum is holding its first exhibition dedicated to men's fashion. The 'Fashioning Masculinities: The Art of Menswear' exhibition would display menswear from centuries, including the 18th century to the present date, while shining light on designers, tailors and artists. "The approach to...show was to look at both fashion and art," senior curator of fashion Claire Wilcox said.

102.title: To oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress: Rebel leaders
102.article_body: After meeting post Congress' loss in recent Assembly polls, party's G-23 leaders said in order to oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress. The leaders demanded Congress to initiate dialogue with like-minded forces to create way for credible alternative for 2024 general elections. They added that only way forward for Congress is to adopt model of collective and inclusive leadership.

103.title: Only shows requesting position of Russian side: Ukraine on report of tentative peace plan
103.article_body: After Financial Times said Ukraine, Russia have drawn up tentative peace plan to end war, Ukraine's presidential adviser Mikhail Podolyak tweeted, "FT published a draft, which represents requesting position of...Russian side. Nothing more." "Ukrainian side has its own positions. Only thing we confirm...is ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops and security guarantees from...countries," he said.

104.title: Germany records 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
104.article_body: Germany's Robert Koch Institute (RKI) on Wednesday reported 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases. The country's seven-day incidence rate rose to a record 1,607 infections per 1,00,000 people for the first time over the past week. The RKI also reported 269 COVID-19 related deaths, raising the total death toll in Germany since the pandemic began to 1,26,142.

105.title: Barcelona sign shirt, stadium sponsorship deal with Spotify
105.article_body: Barcelona on Tuesday said it signed a shirt and stadium sponsorship deal with audio streaming site Spotify. The brand's name will appear on the front of the men's and women's team shirts for four years from the 2022/23 campaign onwards. The club's stadium will also be renamed to Spotify Camp Nou. The deal is reportedly worth over $300 million.

106.title: Anything can happen: Red Bull’s Verstappen ahead of Bahrain Grand Prix
106.article_body: Red Bull's Formula One world champion Max Verstappen believes that "anything can happen" ahead of the Bahrain Grand Prix on March 20. "The car looks good and as a team, we are in a good place," the 24-year-old said. "I'm looking forward to seeing where we are compared to the rest of the grid come qualifying on Saturday," he added.

107.title: Coming from a broken home, music was the only avenue I had: Shruti
107.article_body: Actress and musician Shruti Haasan in an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla shared her experience with music. "Coming from a broken home, and not having a way to express myself, music was the only avenue I had," the 36-year-old said on music being everything for her. She revealed she sang English numbers at a restaurant in Mumbai when nobody knew her.

108.title: I am going to relax, watch a movie: Pooja Hegde on her Holi plans
108.article_body: In an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla recently, actress Pooja Hegde opened up about her plans for Holi and said she's "going to relax and watch a movie". While sharing her childhood memories of the festival, she added, "Now as an actor, I...don't have the liberty of playing Holi because I am always shooting something...I don't want to take the risk.

109.title: Russia accuses Bangladeshi media of 'biased' coverage on Ukraine war
109.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to Bangladesh, Alexander Mantytskiy, has written an open letter to Bangladeshi media outlets, accusing them of "biased" reportage on Ukraine invasion. Mantytskiy stated that the media outlets were following "anti-Russian propaganda", motivated by "prejudice". Reacting to it, a Bangladeshi news editor said that a foreign ambassador shouldn't tell journalists how to do their job.

110.title: Cong appoints leaders to assess situation after loss in 5 states
110.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday appointed senior leaders Jairam Ramesh, Ajay Maken, Jitendra Singh, Rajani Patil and Avinash Pandey to assess the post-poll situation and suggest organisational changes. This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states. Sonia had on Tuesday asked the party's state unit chiefs in these states to resign.

111.title: K'taka ACB raids 18 govt officials; gold necklaces, cars recovered
111.article_body: The Karnataka Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Wednesday conducted raids against 18 officers regarding disproportionate asset cases and started searches at 75 places across the state. ACB seized three cars, eight gold necklaces from Bengaluru's Traffic Safety Department's Additional Commissioner Gnanendra Kumar. ACB seized a bungalow belonging to engineer Ashok Reddy of Krishna Bhagya Jala Nigam.

112.title: Ukraine captures hacker who was allegedly helping Russian troops
112.article_body: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has captured a hacker that the country claims was helping the Russian troops with mobile communications in Ukraine. According to SBU, the hacker was allegedly helping to route calls from within Russia to the mobile phones of Russian troops in Ukraine. The hacker was also sending text messages to Ukrainian officers proposing they surrender.

113.title: Jharkhand break world record for taking highest-ever lead in a first-class match
113.article_body: Jharkhand have broken the world record for taking the highest-ever lead in a first-class match. Jharkhand took a total lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland in their Ranji Trophy 2021-22 pre-quarterfinal. Jharkhand were bowled out for 880 in their first innings before dismissing Nagaland for 289. Jharkhand scored 417/6 in their second innings as the match ended in a draw.

114.title: They made me feel ugly: Vidya on producers replacing her in films
114.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan in a recent interview shared how producers replaced her in over a dozen films and behaved very badly with her. "They made me feel so ugly that for six months, I couldn't...look at myself in the mirror," she said. The 43-year-old recalled how during one such rejection she walked for hours and "cried a lot".

115.title: Record 4,00,000 new COVID-19 cases recorded in South Korea in 24 hours
115.article_body: South Korea reported a record 4,00,741 new daily COVID-19 cases, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Wednesday. According to the Associated Press, South Korea saw its deadliest day yet of the pandemic on Tuesday, with 293 deaths. South Korea is currently grappling with a record surge in coronavirus infections driven by the fast-moving omicron variant.

116.title: Pics show India's first rapid rail; can cover Delhi-Meerut distance in 55 minutes
116.article_body: The first look of India's first rapid rail, which will run on the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut corridor and cover a distance of 82 km in just 55 minutes, has been unveiled by National Capital Regional Transport Corporation. The upcoming RRTS trains will reportedly have 2×2 transverse seating, overhead luggage racks, CCTV cameras, sockets at every seat for laptop/mobile charging among other amenities.

117.title: Was asked to praise mediocre contestants: Sonu on Hindi reality shows
117.article_body: Singer Sonu Nigam has said that he has turned down several Hindi reality shows because he's tired of being asked to praise contestants even when the song isn't good. "I don't like that...I don't look forward to earning money and I don't see the necessity of being a part of a show just for the sake of it," he added.

118.title: The Kashmir Files used to divert attention from issues: Raj minister
118.article_body: Rajasthan Food and Civil Supplies Minister Pratap Khachariyawas on Wednesday said BJP is using 'The Kashmir Files' to divert people's attention from issues like inflation and unemployment. He blamed BJP for the exodus of Kashmiri pandits, saying it was their government at the Centre when it took place. "The Congress has fought against terrorism and always opposed it," he said.

119.title: ICC Prosecutor holds virtual meeting with Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
119.article_body: The International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan on Wednesday held a virtual meeting with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during his visit to Ukraine. "I was pleased to hold important exchanges with the president while in the country," Khan said. Both agreed that all efforts were necessary to "ensure international humanitarian law is respected".

120.title: If Kashmir Files can be made, Lakhimpur Files can be made too: Akhilesh
120.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said if the movie The Kashmir Files can be made on Kashmir, then Lakhimpur Files can also be made. In October 2021, a car belonging to the son of the Minister of State for Home Affairs, Ajay Mishra allegedly ran over farmers, who were protesting against farm laws in Lakhimpur Kheri.

121.title: How does 2022 Women's World Cup points table read after India's 2nd defeat?
121.article_body: After suffering their second defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup, India are now on the third position on the points table with four points from four matches. Australia are on top of the table with four wins in four matches. Pakistan, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are last on the table.

122.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic free to play French Open 2022 as things stand, say organisers
122.article_body: Unvaccinated players, including Novak Djokovic, will be free to play at French Open 2022 as things stand, the French Tennis Federation (FFT) said on Wednesday.  "Our goal is to have the best possible entry list," tournament director Amelie Mauresmo said. Djokovic was not allowed to play Australian Open due to his COVID-19 vaccination status.

123.title: My mother supported me despite health & financial problems: Shantanu
123.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari said that his mother supported his talent of dancing despite having health and financial issues. "She did whatever she could do in Calcutta to make sure...I'm participating in all the competitions, I'm being visible in the shows where named artists are coming," he stated. Shantanu added that he started performing for money to support his family financially.

124.title: Russia suffering heavy losses in Ukraine: UK's Ministry of Defence
124.article_body: The UK's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Russia has suffered "heavy losses" as they continue to face "sustained" Ukrainian resistance, adding it's likely the casualty toll is making it difficult to launch offensive operations. "Continued personnel losses will also make it difficult for Russia to secure occupied territory," it said. Around 5,000 Russian troops have reportedly been killed.

125.title: Japan to revoke Russia's 'Most Favoured Nation' status amid Ukraine war
125.article_body: Japan will revoke Russia's 'Most Favoured Nation' (MFN) status amid Ukraine invasion, PM Fumio Kishida has said. Japan will impose curbs on export of luxury items to Russia and ban import of goods from there, he added. The MFN status calls for World Trade Organization member countries to treat each other equally with respect to few trade barriers, low tariffs.

126.title: Russia-Ukraine war is a massively destabilising event: Zuckerberg
126.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday said the Russia-Ukraine war is a "massively destabilising world event". "It's really tough to find the right words that really mean anything in a situation like this," he said. Meta is working to continue running its services in the region so that Ukrainians can continue using them, Zuckerberg added.

127.title: Ola Electric appoints ex-LG Chem Power CEO Prabhakar Patil to board
127.article_body: Former LG Chem Power CEO Prabhakar Patil has been appointed to the board of Ola Electric, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said on Wednesday. "We'll set up a cutting edge cell manufacturing facility with up to 50GWh capacity...in India. Dr Prabhakar's expertise will help the company accelerate this process of bringing indigenously designed and manufactured cells to the market," Aggarwal said.

128.title: Congress' G-23 leaders meet after party's poor performance in polls
128.article_body: A group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, met at senior leader Ghulam Nabi Azad's residence, days after the party performed poorly in five Assembly elections. Those who reportedly attended the meeting were Kapil Sibal, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Mani Shankar Aiyar and Shashi Tharoor. The leaders met amid calls for a change in Congress' leadership.

129.title: Ryan's so instantaneous with responses of lines, it's inspiring: Zoe
129.article_body: Actress Zoe Saldana, speaking about working with Ryan Reynolds in 'The Adam Project', has said, "He's witty, but when you get to meet him, he's so down to earth." She further revealed that Ryan writes his material and added, "He's just so instantaneous with the responses of lines and things like that. It's inspiring to witness that."

130.title: No plan to privatise Indian Railways, no ban on recruitment: Minister
130.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Wednesday said the government has no plans to privatise the Indian Railways and that there's no ban on recruitment. "The track belongs to railways, stations belong to railways, engines belong to railways, trains belong to railways, signalling systems belong to railways," he said. He further added that recruitment is going on for 1.14 lakh vacancies.

131.title: College student dies by suicide in MP; note recovered
131.article_body: A private college student allegedly died by suicide by jumping off a building in MP's Indore. The second-year BCom student, identified as Rajani Nilore, also left a handwritten suicide note. The incident is said to have taken place in the Banganga locality of the city, police said on Wednesday.

132.title: Allow Ukraine returned students to intern in govt colleges: WB CM
132.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi to provide suggestions to accommodate and allow Ukraine returned students to intern in government medical colleges. She has asked that students in "different years of studies" be accommodated "at an equivalent level in private medical colleges" and for colleges to increase the number of seats.

133.title: JDU leader's grandson shot dead in road robbery bid in Bihar
133.article_body: The grandson of a senior leader of Janata Dal United (JDU) was shot dead in Bihar's Chapra city as he resisted a robbery bid. The incident happened on Wednesday when JDU leader Baijnath Prasad Bikal's grandson Dipak Kumar was travelling on a motorbike. Many villagers assembled at the scene and blocked the road for three hours following the incident.

134.title: 15 people missing after landslide buries at least 60 homes in Peru
134.article_body: Eight people have been rescued and at least 15 are missing after a major landslide in Peru's La Libertad region, the government said on Wednesday. The landslide, which occurred on Tuesday, has left around 60 to 80 homes buried underground, according to local authorities. Meanwhile, the National Civil Defense Institute said the landslide was the result of heavy rains.

135.title: MP clinic's doctor accused of chopping off employee's private part
135.article_body: A doctor at a dental clinic in MP's Sidhi district has been accused of chopping off an employee's private part. A case was, however, registered against the employee after the doctor and clinic-owner, who was also found injured, lodged a complaint about the employee first. Police said further action would be taken after results of the employee's medical report.

136.title: Gandhi family Cong's best leadership option during crisis: Khurshid
136.article_body: Amid growing dissent within the Congress, party leader Salman Khurshid said that the Gandhi family is the party's best possible leadership option in this "moment of crisis". Khurshid further said that the party leaders want Rahul Gandhi to take over as full-time Congress president. "I hope he does so after internal polls," he said.

137.title: Navi Mumbai police sub-inspector held for accepting ₹10,000 bribe
137.article_body: A police sub-inspector in Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra, has been arrested for allegedly accepting ₹10,000 as bribe. The policeman, identified as 29-year-old Sagar Pawar, had reportedly demanded ₹20,000 initially to help the complainant, who had a case of molestation registered against him. Pawar allegedly threatened to make his case strong if he didn't give him the bribe.

138.title: Mumbai's ANC seizes 32 kg marijuana worth ₹8 lakhs; 2 arrested
138.article_body: The Anti-Narcotic Cell of the Mumbai crime branch has arrested two people and seized 32 kilograms of marijuana worth ₹8 lakhs from them. Police found them walking suspiciously and intervened to find 17 kg of marijuana worth ₹4.25 lakhs with one person and 15 kilograms of marijuana worth ₹3.75 lakhs with the other, said DCP (ANC) Datta Nalawade.

139.title: 3 dead, 3 critically ill after consuming spurious alcohol in Bengal
139.article_body: At least three people have died after consuming spurious alcohol in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district, police said on Wednesday. Three others, who were reported to be critically ill, were admitted to a hospital in Baruipur for treatment, Baruipur SP said. The accused had mistaken formalin pesticide for water and mixed it with alcohol, reports stated.

140.title: Russia ordered to immediately stop Ukraine invasion by International Court of Justice
140.article_body: The UN's highest court, the International Court of Justice (ICJ), on Wednesday ordered Russia to immediately stop invasion of Ukraine. "The order is binding under international law. Russia must comply immediately. Ignoring the order will isolate Russia even further," tweeted Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "Ukraine gained a complete victory in its case against Russia at the ICJ," he wrote.

141.title: Jamia Millia Islamia professor arrested for accepting ₹1 lakh bribe
141.article_body: The CBI has arrested a professor of Jamia Millia Islamia's civil engineering department for accepting a bribe of ₹1 lakh from a Delhi-based architecture firm, officials said on Wednesday. His two more associates were also arrested. The professor had allegedly given the structural safety certificate to Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso apartment, a part of which collapsed recently and two women died.

142.title: Will use salary for orphan girls' weddings & poor kids: U'khand MLA Umesh
142.article_body: Umesh Kumar, the newly-elected MLA from Khanpur in Uttarakhand, said on Tuesday that he will use his salary for the weddings of orphan girls and to help poor children. "Not a single rupee will be spent on personal expenses," he tweeted. Kumar, whose sting operation in 2016 against former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat gained attention, fought as an independent candidate.

143.title: Russian tech entrepreneurs to launch 'Rossgram' app after Instagram banned
143.article_body: Russian technology entrepreneurs are set to launch a photo-sharing app named 'Rossgram' in the domestic market after Russia banned Instagram. The app will launch on March 28 and have additional functions such as crowdfunding and paid access for some content. According to a photo shared by the entrepreneurs, Rossgram's colour scheme and layout will bear a strong resemblance to Instagram.

144.title: Brothers aged 8 & 6 found a month after getting lost in Amazon forest
144.article_body: Two brothers aged eight and six have been found alive almost a month after they got lost in Amazon rainforest in the Brazilian state of Amazonas. Pictures of the boys after their rescue showed them malnourished and extremely thin. They were spotted by a man cutting wood in the forest on Tuesday after police called off search for the children.

145.title: 2 million households lose power as 7.3 magnitude earthquake hits Japan
145.article_body: At least two million households were left without power, including 7,00,000 in Tokyo, electricity provider TEPCO said, after a 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit Japan. In the northeastern region, 1,56,000 households had no power, regional energy company Tohoku Electric Power said. Authorities have warned residents in Fukushima, Miyagi and Yamagata prefectures to expect aftershocks.

146.title: I’m focused on being the healthiest I can be: Hamilton on new F1 season
146.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he is focusing on being the healthiest he can be ahead of the new F1 season. "So, I think today, I feel the healthiest, the fittest I've ever been," he said. The new F1 season begins in Bahrain on March 20. Hamilton will feature for Mercedes alongside new teammate George Russell.

147.title: McLaren’s Ricciardo set to feature in Bahrain after -ve COVID-19 test
147.article_body: McLaren on Wednesday said driver Daniel Ricciardo has tested negative for COVID-19 and will return on Thursday ahead of the Formula One 2022 season opener in Bahrain on March 20. "Daniel has been feeling better each day as he continued to recover while in isolation following local regulations in Bahrain," McLaren said. Ricciardo tested positive for COVID-19 on March 11.

148.title: It's another tough moment for us: De Gea on Man Utd's CL exit
148.article_body: Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea said the club's exit from Champions League after losing 1-2 on aggregate to Atletico Madrid was "another tough moment for us". United will end a fifth consecutive campaign without a trophy since winning the Europa League in 2017. "There are too many years without any trophies, even without fighting for trophies," he said.

149.title: Need to change the way women are portrayed in TV shows: Archana
149.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh said that there's a need for a big change in the content and the way women are portrayed on television. Recalling her 1980s show 'Mr Ya Mrs', she said, "Women were shown to step out, work and earn for the family." "Currently, TV shows portray how the woman is always crying...always sacrificing her needs," Archana added.

150.title: Women tie up rape accused to tree, lynch him in Tripura's Dhalai
150.article_body: A 46-year-old rape accused was tied to a tree and lynched by a group of women in Tripura's Dhalai district on Wednesday, police said. The man had allegedly raped a five-year-old girl in a jungle on Tuesday night, who was later rescued by locals. The accused, who was beaten up the next day, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital.

151.title: Tip of the iceberg: WHO as number of COVID-19 cases rises again in countries
151.article_body: Amid global rise in COVID-19 cases, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said, "These increases are occurring despite reductions in testing in some countries, which means the cases we're seeing are just the tip of the iceberg." He added there are "unacceptably high levels of mortality" in many countries as new infections jumped by 8% last week, compared to previous week.

152.title: Who are India's 10 richest people and what are their net worths as per Hurun?
152.article_body: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person and 9th-richest worldwide with $103 billion wealth, as per 2022 Hurun Global Rich List. Adani & family are 2nd-richest in India, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family, Serum Institute's Cyrus Poonawalla and ArcelorMittal's Lakshmi Mittal. DMart's Radhakishan Damani & family are 6th richest in India and SP Hinduja & family 7th richest.

153.title: Akhilesh shares clip of convoy running into bull, says, 'Journey in UP difficult'
153.article_body: Former UP CM and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a clip on Wednesday that showed his convoy running into a bull on the road. "You will meet bulls on your travels, keep going if you can. The journey is very difficult in UP, keep going if you can," Yadav wrote. His car slowed down to give way to the animal.

154.title: Tsunami warning issued after massive earthquake of 7.3 magnitude hits Japan
154.article_body: A 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit the coast of Fukushima in northern Japan on Wednesday evening, triggering a tsunami advisory. The Japan Meteorological Agency said it struck 60 kilometres below the sea. The region is part of northern Japan that was devastated by a deadly 9.0 quake and tsunami in 2011. There are no immediate reports of casualties or damage.

155.title: People wouldn't know truth if not for 'The Kashmir Files': Giriraj Singh
155.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh lauded movie 'The Kashmir Files', stating that people wouldn't come to know the truth if this film wasn’t made. Singh added that the film, which has been made tax-free in eight states, should be shown across all villages in India. Directed by Vivek Agnihotri, 'The Kashmir Files' depicts exodus of Kashmiri Pandit community from Kashmir valley.

156.title: Saudi crown prince meets UK PM Johnson in Riyadh, signs MoU
156.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met United Kingdom PM Boris Johnson in Riyadh on Wednesday, Saudi press agency SPA reported. During the meeting, Saudi Arabia and the UK signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to establish a strategic partnership council, it reported. The leaders of the two nations also discussed bilateral cooperation and means to strengthen it.

157.title: Adani added ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021: Hurun
157.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani, who ranks 12th on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, added an average of ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021, Hurun said. With a net addition of $49 billion, Adani added the most amount of wealth among the world's billionaires. Adani & his family's total wealth is estimated at $81 billion.

158.title: Russia has turned Ukrainian sky into a source of death: Ukraine Prez
158.article_body: Addressing the US Congress on Wednesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Russia has turned...Ukrainian sky into a source of death for thousands of people." He said, "Russia has attacked not just us...it went on...brutal offensive against our values [and] against our right to live freely in our...country." He further urged the US Congress to do more to help the country.

159.title: Bhansali had called me for 'Saawariya' but I was in rehab: Prateik
159.article_body: Prateik Babbar revealed that filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali had called his house to cast him in 'Saawariya' when he was 18 years old. "I was too young...was in rehab so it couldn't have worked out," he added. Prateik stated his grandparents told him about it a few years later. 'Saawariya' marked the Bollywood debut of Ranbir Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor.

160.title: Shafali can provide India something exceptional vs Australia: Hussain
160.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said India Women will need something "exceptional" to beat Australia in their upcoming 2022 Women's World Cup match, adding that opener Shafali Verma can make the difference. "You can't just prod along. You are going to need something above par. Shafali can provide that," stated Hussain. India Women will take on Australia on March 19.

161.title: Govt restores 5-yr e-tourist visas to156 nations after 2 yrs: Reports
161.article_body: Two years after suspending them over the COVID-19 outbreak, the government has restored valid five years e-tourist visas given to citizens of 156 countries, reports said on Wednesday. It restored regular paper visas given to nationals of all countries with immediate effect. Further, all currently valid 10 years regular tourist visas, given to US and Japan's citizens, have been restored.

162.title: Most men weren't willing to do a film where 60% was me: Kriti Sanon
162.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said that she's been in situations where most of the male actors weren't willing to be a part of the film where 60% was her role. "These things need to change a little," Kriti added. Talking about Akshay Kumar's small role in 'Atrangi Re', Kriti said, "Akshay is...not insecure of anyone, and plays his part honestly."

163.title: My family was shocked: Raashii Khanna on her performance in 'Rudra...'
163.article_body: Sharing her family's reaction to her performance in 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness', actress Raashii Khanna said, "My family and friends were shocked...They...never thought I could pull a character like this off." "I never thought I could pull it off," added Raashii. "I had always been looking for something that threw me out of my comfort zone," stated Raashii.

164.title: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy orders daily minute of silence for war victims
164.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has ordered a daily minute of silence for the victims of the Russian invasion. He said, "Every morning at 9 am we'll remember...Ukrainians who gave their lives." Zelenskyy said the initiative mourns both Ukrainian soldiers and civilians killed in the war, adding, "All of them who could still be alive if Russia hadn't started this war."

165.title: Every other team may make a big deal of Chahar's absence but not CSK: Vettori
165.article_body: Talking about Deepak Chahar, who may miss a few CSK matches in IPL 2022 due to a hamstring injury, Daniel Vettori said, "Every other team might make a big deal out of it but [not] CSK." "I think they are one of the few teams that can survive spending ₹14 crore on a player and just moving on," added Vettori.

166.title: Muslim cleric calls for K'taka bandh tomorrow against HC's hijab order
166.article_body: The Ameer-E-Shariat Karnataka, Maulana Sagir Ahmad Khan Rashadi, has asked the Muslim community to implement a day-long bandh on Thursday in Karnataka to protest against HC's order of upholding the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions. Saying that the protest will be peaceful, he added, "You shouldn't impose bandh by forcibly closing shops." He described the order as 'sad'.

167.title: New variant of COVID-19 detected in Israel
167.article_body: Israel's Ministry of Health has said that two cases of a new COVID-19 strain have been detected in the country. "Two cases of verified strains of a combined variety of varieties BA1 (Omicron) and BA2 were discovered in the State of Israel. This strain is not yet known in the world," it stated. It added that patients showed mild symptoms.

168.title: Pregnant Malaysian woman gifts husband ₹3cr Lamborghini over sleepless nights ahead
168.article_body: An expecting mother in Malaysia has bought her husband a Lamborghini Huracan Evo worth RM 2 million (over ₹3 crore) as a reward for the long, sleepless nights that await him once she gives birth. Anes Ayuni Osman, 19, is an entrepreneur who married in February 2021. She said she's scheduled to deliver her firstborn at the end of March.

169.title: Mukesh Ambani only Indian to enter the top 10 in Hurun Global Rich List 2022
169.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani is the only Indian to feature among the top 10 people on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. With a 24% y-o-y increase in wealth, Ambani was ranked 9th among the world's billionaires, with his wealth estimated at $103 billion. Gautam Adani & family ranked 12th globally, with their wealth estimated at $81 billion.

170.title: I'll do the film only if I'm not paid: Salman Khan reportedly told 'Godfather' makers
170.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was offered "a handsome amount" by the makers of Chiranjeevi-starrer upcoming film 'Godfather', but he didn't charge a single penny for his appearance, Pinkvilla reported. "Salman had put forth a clear condition – 'I will do the film, only if you don't pay me'," the report added. Salman loves and respects Chiranjeevi, the report said.

171.title: Chahal takes over RR's Twitter account, says 'Where are you my love Ashwin'
171.article_body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal took over Rajasthan Royals' Twitter account and jokingly tweeted, "Where are you my love @ashwinravi99. No calls, no texts...Is there anyone else in your life?" Chahal also shared a picture of himself and wrote, "Meet RR new captain." Further, sharing another picture, he joked, "10,000 retweets and he will open with Jos Buttler uncle."

172.title: It's a better time to be female actor than male actor: Vidya Balan
172.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, in an interview, said it's a better time to be a female actor than being a male actor. "Variety in the way...roles are written is far more exciting than what's happening in the male actor's space," Vidya said. Adding to it, Shefali Shah stated that OTT platforms have given actresses a chance to explore, express, and experiment.

173.title: Starbucks CEO to step down, Founder Howard Schultz to return as interim CEO
173.article_body: Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson will step down from his role on April 4 and Founder Howard Schultz will take over as interim CEO, the company announced on Wednesday.
