347.article_body: The entire Punjab will come together today and take a pledge to make a prosperous Punjab, Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal tweeted on Wednesday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Punjab's CM designate Bhagwant Mann. "To witness that historic moment, I have also left for Khatkar Kalan, the native village of Shaheed Bhagat Singh," Kejriwal tweeted.

348.title: Delhi police asked to make security arrangements after 'The Kashmir..' release
348.article_body: After the release of 'The Kashmir Files', Deputy Commissioners of Police (DCPs) in Delhi have been asked to make security arrangements. "Movie is based on lives of Kashmiri Pandits...trailer purported to portray Muslims slaughtering Kashmiri Pandits...injuring community's sentiments," a letter to DCPs said, adding, "Adequate police arrangements...suggested, especially in mixed population areas."

349.title: Workers invade Luv Ranjan's film sets over non-payment of ₹1.2 crore: Reports
349.article_body: Protesting alleged non-payment of ₹1.2 crore, scores of workers invaded the sets of director-producer Luv Ranjan's upcoming film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor, reports said. They reportedly claimed that around 350 people who had worked on a song for the film in October last year had not been paid the amount. Police were reportedly called on the sets.

350.title: I don't know why the Russians shot me: 9-yr-old Ukrainian girl after losing her arm
350.article_body: Sasha, a nine-year-old Ukrainian girl who lost her arm in a Russian attack, said that she doesn't know why the Russians shot her. "I hope it was an accident and that they didn't mean to hurt me," she added. Sasha's father was killed after the Russian troops opened fire on their car as they were fleeing a Kyiv suburb.

351.title: Russia's space chief, who called Musk 'little devil', invited him home 6 months ago
351.article_body: Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin, who called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "little devil" after he challenged President Vladimir Putin for a single combat, praised Musk six months ago. Rogozin even invited Musk to his home in Russia in September and said he'd "already set the teakettle on heat". Rogozin wanted to discuss "exploring the universe" with Musk.

352.title: What's the point of taking pressure over price tag: GT's ₹9-crore buy Tewatia
352.article_body: All-rounder Rahul Tewatia, who was bought for ₹9 crore by Gujarat Titans, has said he's not feeling any pressure over his price tag and wants to fulfil the role for which he was bought in the auction. He added, "The team is showing belief in you and that's why they are ready to spend that kind of money on you."

353.title: Today is an important day: PM as India starts COVID vaccination of 12-14 age group
353.article_body: As India started vaccinating children aged 12 to 14 years, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Today is an important day in India's efforts to vaccinate our citizens." "Now onwards, youngsters in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccines and all those above 60 are eligible for precaution doses. I urge people in these age groups to get vaccinated," he wrote.

354.title: Influencer whose pic was wrongly printed on wanted poster sues US police for ₹230 crore
354.article_body: A female Instagram influencer whose picture was wrongly printed on wanted poster has sued the New York City Police Department for $30 million (nearly ₹230 crore) in damages. Eva Lopez said that the poster caused "emotional distress". Lopez was vacationing in Florida in 2021 when she saw the wanted poster for the first time.

355.title: Russian news editor who protested against war on state TV fined 30,000 roubles
355.article_body: The Russian woman who held a "No War" sign during live state TV news bulletin to protest against the attack on Ukraine was fined 30,000 roubles (approximately ₹21,000) by a court. She was held guilty of flouting protest legislation. Marina Ovsyannikova, a mother of two, had pleaded not guilty and was released after she paid the fine.

356.title: Five dead, 17 injured in road accident in Chhattisgarh
356.article_body: Five people died and 17 were injured after a tractor-trolley collided with a truck in Gariaband district of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, police said. All the victims belonging to Majarkatta were returning from a function in Mohlai. An ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for families of the deceased and ₹50,000 each for the injured was announced by Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel.

357.title: Peace talks with Russia sounding more realistic: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
357.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the peace talks with Russia are beginning to "sound more realistic" after nearly three weeks of the war. "However, time is still needed for the decisions to be in the interests of Ukraine," he said in a Facebook address. The talks, which are being held via video conference, are due to continue on Wednesday.

358.title: PM talks like Atal Bihari Vajpayee but doesn't act like him: Shashi Tharoor
358.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi, at times, displayed certain traits of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee by saying the right things but the difference is that those right words have not translated into actions. "If only he can start implementing some of the thoughts that he has said publicly, he might serve the country better," Tharoor added.

359.title: Vadodara constable's wife allegedly dies by suicide, family alleges torture
359.article_body: Vadodara Police has launched a probe after alleged suicide of a constable's 25-year-old wife. The family of deceased, Ankita Aparthy, has alleged domestic violence and mental torture in the case. "My sister was being mentally harassed for several months. She had been complaining to us and has been murdered...Her husband has not even come to meet us," Ankita's brother said.

360.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu resigns as Punjab Congress chief
360.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu has resigned as the Punjab Congress chief. This comes after Congress President Sonia Gandhi asked the state heads of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur to resign from their posts to reorganise the Pradesh Congress Committees. "As desired by the Congress President I have sent my resignation," Sidhu tweeted.

361.title: Muslims shouldn't think this judgement is against them: Assam CM on hijab verdict
361.article_body: After the Karnataka High Court upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the court's judgement is logical. "Schools/colleges should have a uniform dress code. Muslims should not think that this judgement is against them," Sarma added. "This judgement is in the right step towards implementing the diktat of the Quran," Sarma stated.

362.title: I don't even know what insecurity is: Akshay on being compared to other actors
362.article_body: Speaking about being compared to other actors, Akshay Kumar said that he doesn't even know what "insecurity" is. He added that when he entered Bollywood it was a huge thing for him to just get to look at his poster. "It was a [big] deal for me to just be able to work with someone like Sanjay Dutt," Akshay said.

363.title: 45-yr-old man killed in hit and run accident in Chandigarh
363.article_body: A 45-year-old petrol pump employee died in a hit and run accident after he was mowed down by an unknown vehicle near Matka Chowk, Chandigarh, on Tuesday morning. The man was heading towards Press Light point from Matka Chowk on his two-wheeler at around 7:45 am when a rashly driven vehicle ran over him, according to the police.

364.title: Absconding don’s illegally constructed properties demolished in Meerut
364.article_body: Six shops and a factory “illegally constructed” in a government park in Meerut’s Transport Nagar area were demolished by the local district administration on Tuesday, officials said.  Police said they were constructed by local don Badan Singh alias Baddo, who later sold it to others. Baddo is wanted in several cases and is carrying a reward of ₹2.5 lakh.

365.title: Elon Musk changes his Twitter name to 'Elona' as Putin's ally calls him effeminate
365.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk changed his Twitter name to 'Elona' after Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally and the Chechen Republic's head Ramzan Kadyrov mocked him as "effeminate". Kadyrov said, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's." "You'll need to pump up those muscles...to change from the gentle (effeminate) Elona into the brutal Elon you need to be," he added.

366.title: Don't really understand the point of this: Neesham on new 'catch out' rule for batters
366.article_body: Reacting to MCC's new rule that new batters will face next delivery after a player is given out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken, New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "I don’t really understand the point of this." He added, "Has this rule ever been a problem? Also rewards batsmen who don't stay aware of match situation."

367.title: Sensex jumps 900 points in early trade, Nifty above 16,900
367.article_body: The Indian benchmark indices opened higher on Wednesday amid positive global cues. In early trade, the Sensex jumped more than 900 points to trade near 56,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 250 points to trade above 16,900 levels. Banks and financials, including IndusInd Bank and Axis Bank, were among top Sensex gainers.

368.title: Bad phase began after heartbreak with Amy, I disappeared completely: Prateik
368.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said "bad phase" in his life began after he had a heartbreak with his 'Ekk Deewana Tha' co-star Amy Jackson. "I fell in love with that woman (Amy)...it just went haywire...Heartbreak at 25 years old hits different...Then I completely disappeared," he added. Amy and Prateik reportedly dated each other in 2012 but broke up soon after.

369.title: India buying discounted crude oil from Russia does not violate US sanctions: US
369.article_body: India taking up Russia's offer of discounted crude oil would not be a violation of US sanctions, the White House has said. "Our message to any country continues to be that abide by the sanctions that we have put in place and recommended," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at a press briefing on Tuesday.

370.title: It's not over yet: Babar on his century while chasing Aus' 506-run target
370.article_body: Chasing a 506-run target, Pakistan ended Day 4 at 192/2, needing 314 runs to win the second Test against Australia. Reacting to it, captain Babar Azam, who's unbeaten at 102, said the match is not over yet. "We need to continue playing in the same way," he added. Babar and Abdullah Shafique have added 171 runs for the third wicket.

371.title: Contamination due to cracks in old pipeline led to diarrhoea outbreak in Guj
371.article_body: Cracks in the 40-year-old pipeline that supplies drinking water to the Kalol municipality in Gujarat led to its contamination causing diarrhoea outbreak in the area, State Health and Family Welfare Minister Nimishaben Suthar said on Tuesday. An eight-month-old infant has died and 554 residents have complained of vomiting and diarrhoea with 93 hospitalisations in Kalol since March 6.

372.title: Three men arrested for raping woman in J&K's Poonch
372.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police arrested three men for allegedly raping and threatening a woman with death in Jammu & Kashmir's Poonch. The woman in her complaint alleged that an acquaintance of hers called her to his place to discuss marriage and took her to an abandoned house. He then called two of his neighbours there and raped her, she claimed.

373.title: India reports 2,876 COVID-19 cases, 3,884 recoveries in the 24 hours
373.article_body: India has reported 2,876 new COVID-19 cases, 3,884 recoveries, and 98 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,568 cases and 97 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,072, while the active caseload declined to 32,811.

374.title: It'll be support for invasion: US on if India buys discounted crude oil from Russia
374.article_body: On being asked about possibility that India could take up Russian offer of discounted crude oil, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "Think where you want to stand when history books are written in this moment in time." "Support for Russian leadership is support for invasion that is having a devastating impact," she further said.

375.title: Tripura govt hikes wage of tea garden workers by ₹31
375.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Deb on Tuesday announced a hike in the wages of the tea garden workers in the state by ₹31. The wages will be increased from the existing ₹105 to ₹136 under the 'Mukhyamantri Cha Shramik Kalyan Prakalp' scheme. "Over 7,000 families dependent on 54 tea estates spread across Tripura are going to benefit directly," said Deb.

376.title: Hijab verdict disappointing, can be widely misused: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
376.article_body: Calling Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban "deeply disappointing", Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has said that the decision will have "a direct impact on religious freedom" and affect education of Muslim girls. It said that the verdict could be misused in other contexts. "Using this verdict as a precedent, any religious practice can be called into question," said an official.

377.title: It won't matter if you don't give Akshay food, but give him work: Farhad
377.article_body: Filmmaker Farhad Samji, who has directed Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey', said, "It won't matter if you don't give Akshay food but give him work. He even wakes up with the dedication that 'I want to work'." "I have seen this side of Akshay sir where if somebody did not get their payment someday, he would give them money," added Farhad.

378.title: Manchester United knocked out of Champions League by Atletico
378.article_body: Manchester United have been knocked out of the Champions League after their 0-1 defeat against Atletico Madrid on Tuesday night in the second leg of the round of 16. Atletico advanced 2-1 on aggregate after a draw in the first leg last month. Meanwhile, Benfica have also advanced to the quarterfinals with a 3-2 aggregate in the last-16 against Ajax.

379.title: Circuit was a stupid role; did Munna Bhai because of Sanjay Dutt: Arshad
379.article_body: Arshad Warsi said it's important for him to know who's the lead actor of the movie, before signing a film. "I did 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.' because it was Sanju (Sanjay Dutt), otherwise even Raju (filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani) knows that it's a stupid role," he added. "It really is on paper...Even (actor) Makrand Deshpande had said no to 'Circuit'," Arshad said.

380.title: Ex-Meta employees' crypto startup turns unicorn with $200 mn funding
380.article_body: Former Meta employees' cryptocurrency startup Aptos has turned unicorn after raising $200 million led by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z). Others who participated in the funding include Tiger Global, Katie Haun, Multicoin Capital, Three Arrows Capital, FTX Ventures and Coinbase Ventures among others. Aptos CEO Mo Shaikh and CTO Avery Ching had left Meta in December.

381.title: Women's panel seeks report from Pune police over stabbing of class 10 girl
381.article_body: The Maharashtra State Commission for Women has sought a report from Pune City Police on the knife attack on a class 10 girl by a 21-year-old man at her school farewell in Pune on Monday. The accused, who's suspected of stalking the 15-year-old girl and making one-sided advances, allegedly attempted suicide by consuming a poisonous substance after stabbing the victim.

382.title: 2 Mumbai police officers suspended after theft suspect commits suicide
382.article_body: A police sub-inspector and constable of the MHB Colony were suspended by the Commissioner for allegedly delaying the probe in a theft case leading to the suspect's suicide. Raj Pawar had allegedly committed suicide last week after he was accused of stealing a bike. His family claimed the policemen threatened Pawar and accepted a bribe of ₹20,000 from his mother.

383.title: People used to recognise me; I used to cover face, go out with Haarsh: Bharti
383.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said she used to cover her face while going out with husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa. "Haarsh used to ask if we can go out to have pakodas...I used to tie cloth on my face...was doing Comedy Circus...People used to recognise me," Bharti said, adding she thought she will be scolded in Punjab if someone proposed marriage in Mumbai.

384.title: Pant can become a better wicketkeeper-batter than MS Dhoni: Jaffer
384.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said that Rishabh Pant can "definitely" become a better wicketkeeper-batter than MS Dhoni. "At such a young age, he has already played some...incredible knocks. In the coming 8-10 years...he will be more mature," stated Jaffer. Pant recently scored the fastest Test fifty by an Indian off 28 deliveries in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

385.title: Man molests 2-yr-old girl by luring her with biscuits in Pune, held
385.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a two-year-old girl in Pune's Bopkhel area after luring her with biscuits. "Parents had both gone for work and girl was alone. He offered her biscuits and took her to forested land at 12:30 pm," police said, adding that the child was found with wounds on her cheeks and hands.

386.title: Russia bans Justin Trudeau and over 300 Canadians from entering the country
386.article_body: Russia has put Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and over 300 Canadians on a 'stop list' that bans them from entering the country. The list includes Foreign Minister Melanie Joly, Defence Minister Anita Anand, and almost all MPs. The move came after Canada sanctioned several Russian officials over its invasion of Ukraine. Russia also banned US President Joe Biden's entry.

387.title: SL captain Karunaratne responds to Harsha Bhogle's tweet after over 2 years, gets trolled
387.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne has been trolled after he responded to a congratulatory tweet by Harsha Bhogle that was posted more than two years ago. "Is everything alright?" a user tweeted. Other tweets read, "Stop using Internet Explorer" and "My brother just searched his name and replied to every tweet he found because...he thought he's just being noticed now."

388.title: 8 held for forging property papers, cheating buyers in Bengaluru
388.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a gang of eight, including two rowdy-sheeters, for allegedly forging property papers of sites on fabricated old stamp papers and selling them to unsuspecting buyers. The accused reportedly sold many sites worth ₹8 crore in and around Bengaluru. Police have recovered 2,130 fake stamp papers, 17 fake sub-registrar office seals, and a typewriter from the gang.

389.title: 6-yr-old girl dies as speeding car hits her on road near her house in Pune
389.article_body: A six-year-old girl died after speeding car hit her in Pune's Kunjirwadi on Sunday. Incident took place when she was on the road near her house. Police said that the car was speeding from Solapur towards Pune. Case under Sections 279, 304(a) of Indian Penal Code along with Sections 184, 132(1)(c), and 119/177 of Motor Vehicle Act has been registered.

390.title: North Korea's missile launch fails
390.article_body: North Korea fired an "unidentified projectile" on Wednesday but the launch appears to have immediately failed, South Korea's military said. Japanese media reported that North Korea had launched a possible ballistic missile, citing an unnamed defence ministry official. North Korea has so far carried out nine weapons tests this year.

391.title: DDA approves 80 hectare redevelopment plan of AIIMS Delhi
391.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority has approved redevelopment of 79.73 hectares of land for AIIMS Delhi's expansion. As part of the plan, a dedicated infectious diseases ward, 50 new operation theatres and a smart library will be built. The plan envisages 1.5 lakh sqm area for state-of-the-art research laboratories, animal facilities, and a clinical trial facility.

392.title: Squatters occupy £50 million UK mansion linked to Russian oligarch
392.article_body: A group of squatters broke into a London mansion that belongs to the family of sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska and hung signs that read 'This property has been liberated' and 'Putin go f*** yourself'. The squatters staged a demonstration on the balcony of the £50 million (around ₹500 crore) mansion, saying they were reclaiming it for Ukrainian refugees.

393.title: Any noise meter app's data can now be used to file complaints in Mumbai
393.article_body: Noise pollution complaints in Mumbai can now be lodged based on any noise monitoring application's data, Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey said. "Citizens can download any free noise meter, take a reading of the decibel level...and lodge a complaint," he said. Pandey had earlier directed major developers to install noise cutters around construction sites in the city by March 31.

394.title: Kapil Sibal doesn't know 'ABC of Congress': Rajasthan CM Gehlot
394.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday criticised fellow party leader Kapil Sibal's remarks on suggesting change in Congress' leadership. Reacting to it, Gehlot stated that Sibal doesn't understand "ABC of Congress", adding that it isn't expected of Sibal to make such statements. Sibal's comments came after Congress' defeat in the recently held Assembly elections in five states.

395.title: Belarus resisting attempts to drag it into Ukraine war: President
395.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko said on Tuesday that the country had intercepted a missile fired at it from Ukraine two days back, but will not engage in the conflict. Lukashenko's comments came after Ukrainian government accused Russia of staging "false flag" air attacks on Belarus from Ukraine in a bid to incite Belarus to join the war.

396.title: Bailable warrant against Shilpa's mother over ₹21 lakh loan case
396.article_body: A Mumbai court on Tuesday issued a bailable warrant against actress Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda in a case over alleged non-repayment of a ₹21 lakh loan. The case was filed by a businessman who claimed that Shilpa's father Surendra had borrowed the money in 2015. Earlier, a summons had been issued to Sunanda and Shilpa and her sister Shamita.

397.title: Gandhi family is heart of party workers: Maharashtra Congress chief
397.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Tuesday said the Gandhi family is heart of Congress workers and Rahul Gandhi will become Congress president by following due process. "Those leaders who are raising questions today should first talk about what they did when they got opportunity," he added. On Monday, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said party leadership is in cuckoo land.

398.title: Australia to lift entry ban for international cruise ships after 2 yrs
398.article_body: Australia is set to lift its entry ban for international cruise ships from April onwards, in a move aimed to further ease COVID-19 restrictions. The current ban that has been in effect since March 2020 will not be renewed beyond April 17, the Australian government has confirmed. Last month, Australia reopened its international borders to vaccinated travellers.

399.title: Was all about love but never thought about marriage: Shama Sikander
399.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who tied the knot with American businessman James Milliron on Monday, said she never thought about marriage. "I was all about love and I still am...but the marriage was something that was not on my (mind)," she stated. "It's because I have seen what happens in marriage and because of the condition I come from," Shama added.

400.title: Frivolous: HC dismisses PIL alleging Delhi CM has Khalistani links
400.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday refused to entertain a public interest litigation petition seeking an inquiry against Aam Aadmi Party and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, alleging that they have links with Khalistani separatists. A Division Bench of Acting Chief Justice Vipin Sanghi and Justice Navin Chawla remarked that the petition was 'completely frivolous'.
